intro: Roldana kerberi var. kerberi, commonly known as the Kerber's roldana, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant typically features lance-shaped leaves and clusters of tubular, brightly colored flowers, often in shades of red or orange. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
